intro: Dryandra nivea var. subevenia, commonly known as the white dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with narrow, leathery leaves. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy choice for coastal gardens. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in botanic gardens and private collections.
